pull.title: Sendmany RPC call
pull.body:
Need for this is being driven by mining pool operators; it is much more efficient to pay lots of people with one transaction rather than lots of little transactions.

Old clients will refuse to relay sendmany transactions, so to ensure timely inclusion in a block mining pool operators should either upgrade together and connect their clients together or wait until a good percentage of the network has had a change to upgrade to the next version of bitcoin.

repo.name: bitcoin-git
repo.description: Feature branches that aren't yet, or never will be, ready for mainline bitcoin

events.message: sendmany RPC command, to send to multiple recipients in one transaction.

issue.title: Relative -datadir=... broken
issue.body:
Trying to start my testnet-in-a-box instances (with master) I get the following error in the console:

Command line:

```
orion@amethyst:~/projects/bitcoin/box$ ../bitcoin/src/bitcoind -datadir=1 -daemon

************************
EXCEPTION: 22DbRunRecoveryException       
DbEnv::open: DB_RUNRECOVERY: Fatal error, run database recovery       
bitcoin in AppInit()       

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'DbRunRecoveryException'
  what():  DbEnv::open: DB_RUNRECOVERY: Fatal error, run database recovery
```

debug.log shows:

```
Bitcoin version v0.6.0-169-g4040598-beta (2012-04-19 18:21:45 +0200)
Default data directory /home/orion/.bitcoin
Loading addresses...
dbenv.open LogDir=1/testnet/database ErrorFile=1/testnet/db.log
************************
EXCEPTION: 22DbRunRecoveryException       
DbEnv::open: DB_RUNRECOVERY: Fatal error, run database recovery       
bitcoin in AppInit()      
```

db.log shows:

```
1/testnet/1/testnet/database: No such file or directory
PANIC: No such file or directory
unable to join the environment
```

I've deleted everything except wallet.dat from the data directory, so that cannot be the problem.

Note the weird `1/testnet/1/testnet/database`. Maybe something is going wrong while building the path?

issue.title: sendmany error
issue.body:
OS is up to date x64 Debian GNU/Linux 7.6 (wheezy).

The problem appeared from a RPC call generated from a pool (NOMP if it is important).
I can say it works fine with other coins.

A problematic transaction hash is 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1, but I can confirm the problem exists with other transactions, too.

From the transaction info one can see the exactly one input was selected - a freshly mined 80 coins. The whole input was chosen.
However, the outputs are totaling a satoshi less.
Furthermore - the pool log states:
.... [Payments]  [feathercoin] Sent out a total of 79.99999999 to 2 workers

Here is the debug.log part from the wallet:

2014-08-21 05:02:29 ThreadRPCServer method=gettransaction
2014-08-21 05:02:29 ThreadRPCServer method=getaccount
2014-08-21 05:02:29 ThreadRPCServer method=sendmany
2014-08-21 05:02:29 SelectCoins() best subset: 80.00 total 80.00
2014-08-21 05:02:29 CommitTransaction:
CTransaction(hash=1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1, ver=1, vin.size=1, vout.size=2, nLockTime=0)
    CTxIn(COutPoint(be3e84b9d6c5e6a9fbd9c09251342e5e29dc75586fefc206b484259776ff4bdd, 0), scriptSig=3045022100be45b357e3bfda)
    CTxOut(nValue=36.25760344, scriptPubKey=OP_DUP OP_HASH160 384e97d51e22)
    CTxOut(nValue=43.74239655, scriptPubKey=OP_DUP OP_HASH160 de08bcfa0940)
AddToWallet 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1  new
2014-08-21 05:02:29 WalletUpdateSpent found spent coin 80.00ftc be3e84b9d6c5e6a9fbd9c09251342e5e29dc75586fefc206b484259776ff4bdd
2014-08-21 05:02:29 AddToWallet 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:29 Relaying wtx 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:29 CreateNewBlock(): total size 2597
2014-08-21 05:02:29 RETARGET: nActualTimespan = 64 before bounds
2014-08-21 05:02:29 RETARGET: nActualTimespanShort = 9, nActualTimespanMedium = 71, nActualTimespanLong = 72, nActualTimeSpanAvg = 50, nActualTimespan (damped) = 57
2014-08-21 05:02:29 RETARGET: nActualTimespan = 57 after bounds
2014-08-21 05:02:29 RETARGET: nTargetTimespan = 60, nTargetTimespan/nActualTimespan = 1.0526
2014-08-21 05:02:29 GetNextWorkRequired RETARGET
2014-08-21 05:02:29 Before: 1c012da5  00000000012da500000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000
2014-08-21 05:02:29 After:  1c011e8f  00000000011e8ff3333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333333
2014-08-21 05:02:29 received getdata for: tx 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:29 received getdata for: tx 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:30 received getdata for: tx 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:30 received getdata for: tx 1954319a2c2a9bca84076af589f31e6849ac6eed68947929ea6a82e13ce109e1
2014-08-21 05:02:31 Flushing wallet.dat
2014-08-21 05:02:31 Flushed wallet.dat 20ms

According to me it looks like the sendmany call is OK and the problem is in the wallet and more specifically in the in the "SelectCoins() best subset: 80.00 total 80.00" part.

My wild guess would be a rounding issue in the wallet code.
